description: Provides funding for services to families who are caring for persons with Alzheimer's and related dementia who meet specific criteria

name: Caregiver Education
description: Provide educational forums, evidence based workshops(Powerful Tools for Caregivers) and presentations regarding caregiving and its challenges to the public

name: Caregiver Support Groups
description: Provide logistical and educational support for caregiver support groups operating in the county.

name: Dementia Education
description: Provide community education focusing on the different types of dementia, issues and challenges

name: Options Counseling (b)
description: Interactive decision-support process that helps people choose the services that will keep them as independent and safe as possible in their communities

name: Personal Care
description: Contract to provide bathing , personal grooming, dressing and other assistance for persons living in their homes

name: Respite
description: Contract for services to enable family care givers to get a rest from their daily caregiving duties Contract to provide bathing , personal grooming, dressing and other assistance for persons living in their homes

name: Appeals & Hearings Assistance - 60+
description: Provides assistance to persons over age 60 in  preparing and filing complaints, grievances,, and appeals at the local and state levels.

name: Disability Appeals & Hearings Assistance
description: Provides advice and assistance in preparing and filing complaints, grievances,, and appeals at the local and state levels.

name: Federal Benefits Education and Outreach
description: Provides education to the public on social Security Disability benefits, Medicare and Medicaid and other public and private benefits

name: Public and Private Disability Benefits Access Assistance Disabled 18-59
description: Provide information and technical assistance on how to access government and private benefits and the responsibilities of program participants for disabled 18-59

name: Public and Private Disability Benefits Access Assistance 60+
description: Provide information and application assistance to persons age 60 + so that they are able to obtain government and private benefits.

name: Health Education and Screening
description: RN services to older adults discussing medications and health concerns

name: Living Well with Chronic Conditions
description: 6 week class that helps educate and empower participants to self manage their chronic health condition.

name: Living Well with Diabetes
description: 6 week class for diabetics or those living with someone who is diabetic that focuses on self-managing their diabetes

name: Senior Center Support
description: Provides reimbursement of up to $6,000 per year to Germantown, Jackson, Hartford and West Bend to enable them to provide educational, recreational, health and wellness programs and general socialization to alleviate the isolation and loneliness of older adults.

name: Senior Farmers Market
description: A USDA program that provides Older Adults at a certain income level with vouchers to at local Farmers Markets and Farm Stands.  This program increases intake of fresh fruits and vegetables and benefits local farmers.

name: Stepping On
description: A Falls Prevention class which emphasizes physical activity/muscle strengthening, improving balance, home safety and medication management

name: Strong People
description: Ongoing strength training class which improves an Older Adults ability to perform Activities of Daily Living and improves flexibility

name: Walk with Ease
description: Walking program which focuses on exercise and education for persons with Arthritis

name: Assessments (b)
description: Required to determine eligibility for home delieved meals using Title III Older American's Act funds, along with assessing the need for other nutrition or supportive services.  In-home assessment required within 4 weeks of starting meals and mandated yearly reassessments to determine continued eligibility.

name: Daily Check-In
description: A daily check when meal is delivered to quickly assess the safety and well-being of home delivered meal participants.  Family members updated on any change in status.

name: Home Delivered Meals(per federal language)
description: Nutritious, wholesome meals delivered to homebound older adults to reduce hunger and food insecurity.  Program targets older adults who have the greatest economic need and are rural.

name: Nutrition Counseling (a)
description: Individualized advice/education to homebound individuals who are at nutritional risk because of their health or nutritional history

name: Nutrition Education (a)
description: Quarterly education to participants and caregivers that promotes better health by providing accurate information regarding health, nutrition and/or physical activity

name: Volunteer Recruitment (a)
description: Continued active recruitment for volunteers to deliver meals to our homebound Senior Dining Participants.  These volunteers provide a daily check-in for our participants.

name: Assessments (a)
description: Required to determine eligibility for congregate meals using Title III Older American's Act funds.  Also assesses the need for other nutrition or supported services.  Required annually.

name: Community Meal Sites
description: Seven sites throughout the county serving wholesome, hot meals to reduce hunger and food insecurity and promote socialization of older adults

name: Nutrition Counseling (b)
description: Individualized advice/education to individuals who are at nutritional risk because of their health or nutritional history

name: Nutrition Education (b)
description: Quarterly education to Senior Dining participants that promotes better health by providing accurate information regarding health, nutrition and/or physical activity

name: Transportation to Dining Sites
description: Transportation available Monday through Friday from a low-income housing unit to our Senior Dining site.  This transportation allows older adults to attend the site and improve socialization and results in them not having to eat alone.

name: Volunteer Recruitment (b)
description: Continued active recruitment of older adult volunteers to help package meals, serve meals, set tables and assist with all aspects of the senior dining program.

name: Senior Loan Closet
description: Provide durable medical equipment and adaptive aids on a short term basis to persons who temporarily need this equipment.

name: Account Verification
description: Review and approve annual accounts and reports for guardianship, conservator and custodial cases. Inform court official of any inconsistencies. Send notices of overdue accounts; schedule hearings as required; arrange for personal service.

name: Appeals
description: Compile the record, transmit circuit court file and supplement under the required timelines and appellate court rules.

name: Case Management
description: Monitor pending caseload, maintain court calendar, process exhibits, update software, monitor and process eFiles, maintain judgment/lien index. Review documents and identify issues in scope of work to be resolved so court hearings are meaningful. Inform court officials of items that need their attention.

name: Clerk in Court
description: Take minutes of proceedings, inform court official of any potential legal deficiencies during hearings, administer oaths, prepare court notices and orders for the court official's signature that result from the hearing; Conduct small claims and traffic initial appearances. Enter default judgments for non-appearance.

name: Costs and Fees
description: Receipting of statutory fees and court ordered financial obligations

name: Financial Services
description: Balance daily deposit, bank accounts, and general ledger; Prepare journal entries; Invest funds as required by court order or at discretion of clerk of court; analyze accounts payable and receivable; Budget preparation and analysis; Prepare and process requests to disburse funds pursuant to court order or WI statutes. Review accounts payable for disbursed funds not claimed by the creditor. Perform research to locate creditors and prepare and file report with county treasurer of funds not claimed or disbursed pursuant to court order

name: Court Orders
description: Review draft orders filed with the office by litigants and attorneys. Inform court official of any potential issues prior to obtaining the court official's signature. May prepare draft orders for the court official. Prepare judgments of conviction and civil judgments.

name: Policies and Procedures
description: Work with state agencies including legislators, county government, and justice system partners to make effective changes to the court system. This may include proposing legislation or filing petitions and testifying when necessary. Review and analyze changes in Washington County Ordinances, State of Wisconsin Statutes, Supreme Court Rules, and Local Court Rules and Orders that affect the Washington County court system or employees, then create and update policy and procedures to comply.

name: Court Tours and Education
description: Prepare and perform tours and presentations

name: Custodian of Records
description: File and keep all papers properly deposited in every action or proceeding. Follow scanning and retention rules for destruction and purging.

name: Assistance to Litigants
description: Assist litigants, attorneys, law enforcement, prosecutors, employees of state and local government offices and agencies, title searchers, and the general public. Guide customers through the court process; provide brochures and mandatory forms; process record requests, review and respond to correspondence and inquiries.

name: Disbursement of Funds
description: Prepare and process requests to disburse funds pursuant to court order and statutes

name: Probate Administration
description: Administration of decedents' estates, testate, and intestate by the registrar. Review and approve annual accounts and reports for guardianship, conservator and custodial cases. Inform court official of any inconsistencies. Send notices of overdue accounts; schedule hearings as required; arrange for personal service.

name: Family Law Assistance
description: Provide volunteer family legal assistance

name: Interpreter Services
description: Provide interpreter services and ADA accommodations at county expense; Prepare interpreter reimbursement request for the Director of State Courts

name: Judicial Administration
description: Administration of judicial business within the circuit court by the commissioner including continuing education

name: Jury
description: Compile prospective juror lists, prepare jury summonses, obtain a sufficient number of jurors, coordinate jury selection, provide jury supplies, review fees and mileage for disbursement

name: Legal Publications
description: Provide legal publications and research materials to court officials, and insert updates in periodicals.

name: Family Court Services - Mediation
description: Administer family court services - Mediation

name: Probation Revocation, Discharge and Prison Release Notification Processing
description: Process notices received informing the courts of revocation, discharge and release of defendant, and respond to inquiries

name: Small Claim and Traffic Returns
description: Conduct small claims and traffic initial appearances. Enter default judgments for non-appearance.

name: Unclaimed Funds
description: Review accounts payable for disbursed funds not claimed by the creditor. Perform research to locate creditors; Prepare and file report with county treasurer of funds not claimed or disbursed pursuant to court order

name: Professional Services
description: Provide court appointed attorneys, guardians ad litem, psychologists, mediators, and transcripts as required by court order or WI Statutes at county expense. Review invoices for accuracy for payment of fees and draft orders for payment and reimbursement; Provide volunteer family legal assistance. Provide interpreter services and ADA accommodations at county expense;

name: Voluntary Case Resolution
description: Appointments, meetings, walk-ins, settlement conferences; some result in stipulations and compromise case resolutions

name: Administative Enforcement-Deliquent Child Support
description: Tax Intercept: Required by federal and state regulations - intercept federal and state tax refunds 45CFR303.72, 45CFR303.102, 49.855; Account Seizure: Seizure of accounts at financial institutions (DCF 152); License Suspension and Denial -Drivers, Professional and Recreational (49.857, DCF 152); Passport Denial: Deficit Reduction Act (DRA) requirement for non-payment of child support; Arrears Payment: administrative increase in income withholding (767.75(1f); Liens: personal and real property through the lien docket (49.854, DCF 152)

name: Public Relations/Outreach/Customer Service/Complaints
description: Community outreach and education; referral resources

name: Training
description: Training staff -internal and external resources

name: Citizen Assistance - Complaint, Intake/Disposition, Outreach, Referral
description: Resolve complaints of citizens

name: Collection - Medical Assistance Subrogation
description: Initiate action to collect subrogation payments in third party suits as a result of medical assistance 49.89

name: Collection - Health Insurance Subrogation
description: Initiate action to collect subrogation payments in third party suits as a result of health insurance

name: Prosecution - Mental Commitment Cases
description: Represent the interests of the public 51.20(4)-involuntary and voluntary mental commitment

name: Training - Emergency Detentions/Protective Placement
description: In-service training for law enforcement 51.15(11m)

name: Campaign Finance Compliance
description: Prepare, send, follow up on campaign finance for County offices

name: Conduct Elections
description: Ballot & election database preparations including election supplies and entry into Statewide Voter Registration System; Candidate & ballot eligibility/certification including prep docs for County candidates; Election day troubleshooting; County canvass reports and notifications; Process election billing from vendors and to municipalities; Election notices; Election Records Maintenance & Archiving per statutes; Result tabulations & reporting

name: County Directories - External
description: Compile & Distribute County Directory and In-House Directory

name: County Plat Book
description: Sell County's Plat Book

name: County Youth Government Day
description: Administer annual County Youth Government Day

name: Dog Claims Processing
description: Respond to Claims for Dog Damage, obtain Finance Committee approvals, prepare voucher

name: Dog Licensing Records Maintenance
description: Provide forms, reports, listings of all dog related records, administer dog license accounts

name: Dog Lister Fees
description: Receive request for Dog Lister Fees, determine sufficiency, prepare vouchers

name: Dog Tags Issuance
description: Order tags from State, determine quantities for municipalities, distribute, maintain records, pay State per Statutes, pay Humane Society per contract

name: Election Worker Training
description: Provide Municipal Clerk, Baseline Chief Inspector, Poll Worker, Staff training.  Attend election training conducted by Gov. Accountability Board

name: Library Services Board Support
description: Provide administrative and clerical support to Library Services Board, determine eligibility for exemption of county library tax, prepare annual Library Board budget, pay all library related invoices, administer Library contract between County and municipalities

name: Domestic Partnerships & Marriage Licenses
description: Prepare license application, worksheet/license, abstract using State's electronic system, review and determine sufficiency of applicant's documents, schedule ceremonies for Court Commissioner, maintain license docket, provide information for applying for a license

name: Notary Public Services
description: Obtain bonds for all County employees obtaining or renewing Notary Public commissions, obtain surety for all county notaries, journal entry departments for costs, provide Notary Public services to general public

name: Oaths of Office
description: Prepare, administer, and maintain all oaths of office

name: Passport Acceptance Agent
description: Review & Determine sufficiency of documents for passport applications,  sign, mail, follow up tracking, maintain appropriate records

name: Probate Claims Notices
description: Receive and process all Probate Claims Notices

name: Public Records Requests
description: Respond to all public records requests for documents within department

name: Redistricting
description: Educate Board, staff for redistricting.  Work with GIS to develop plans, present to Board, implement changes, work with municipalities when creating wards and election districts

name: Wood Cutting Notices
description: Receive and process all wood cutting notices for the county

name: Education & Support - Other Municipalities
description: Assist municipal clerks and treasurers with tax settlements, tax balancing, and assessment rolls  Recommend necessary changes as required by revisions and State Statutes to local treasurers and clerks. Help to find answers to questions, come up with procedures, or give municipality ideas on new technologies and options..

name: Lottery and Gaming Credit Certification and Settlement Management
description: Compile, enter, and reconcile data for April Lottery Credit Settlement.  Prepare payment vouchers for the April Settlement to 20 local municipalities; 12 school districts, and 2 vocational districts. Prepare, maintain, and process the Lottery and Gaming Credit Certifications by reviewing the monthly Real Estate Transfer Returns to see if the primary residence box is checked and verifying to see if the taxpayer is currently receiving the lottery credit on their tax bill

name: Taxpayer and Agency Inquiries / Assistance and Community Education
description: Educate the general public, attorneys, title companies, banks, mortgage companies, and the general public how to access information from our web page for tax information (tax bill copies, payment receipts, assessments, etc.). Answer and assist with incoming customer requests either in person or on the phone. Virtual resource for people of county and general public. Research tax information for payment history, copies of old and new tax bills, or other special projects. Look up information for residents on senior property tax loans, veteran's tax programs, homestead credits, lottery credits and heating assistance. Referrals to Register of Deeds/Real Property Lister to clear up issues with title on property or name changes.

name: Adjudication of Traffic and Ordinance Citations (Adult) pursuant to Wash. Co. Code 4.02(f)
description: Negotiate and handle thousands of traffic and ordinance citations written by the State Patrol, Sheriff's Department and DNR.

name: Adjudication of Traffic and Ordinance Citations (Juv) pursuant to Wash. Co. Code 4.02(f)
description: Negotiate and handle juvenile ordinance violations, such as underage drinking.

name: Appeals, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(5)
description: Handle post-conviction motions for new trials, ineffective assistance, and misdemeanor appeals.

name: Domestic Violence and Sexual Assault Charging Conferences, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 950.04
description: Conduct domestic violence meetings pursuant to statute, assist victims with preparing and filing restraining orders.

name: Citizen Inquiries and Assistance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1)
description: Correspond with citizens about items of concern.

name: Civil Litigation (Forfeiture), pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(2)
description: Preparation of documents for drug civil forfeiture actions, such as vehicle seizures.

name: Criminal Complaints, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 968.02
description: Review police reports from eleven law enforcement agencies for potential criminal charges, which number thousands of cases.

name: Discovery, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 971.23(1)
description: Provide copies on police reports and digital media to defense counsel, pursuant to statute.

name: Document Preparation, Review and Approval, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1)
description: Prepare criminal complaints for each case issued, as well as motions and briefs where needed for the prosecution of the case.

name: Search Warrants, Subpoenas and Law Enforcement Agency Assistance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 968.12 and 968.135
description: Assist with search warrants, subpoenas and some aspects of investigation in complicated matters.

name: Trial and Prosecution Records Maintenance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.07
description: Maintain records and files for court dates and prosecution.

name: Motions, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 971.31
description: File and respond to motions from defense attorneys in order to effectively prosecute charged cases.

name: Plea and Sentencing and Court Escort, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 950.04
description: Negotiate charged cases and appear on behalf of the State at plea and sentencing hearings.

name: Prosecuting Case Management (Adult), pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(2)
description: Organize and maintain files for adult criminal cases.

name: Prosecuting Case Management (Juvenile), pursuant to Wis. Stat. 938.25(1)
description: Organize and maintain files for juvenile delinquency and children in need of protection and/or services (such as neglect cases).

name: Law Enforcement Agencies Inquiries and Assistance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1)
description: Monitor reception area, take calls from law enforcement and attorneys, seek to respond to questions and complaints from citizens.

name: Attorney Inquiries and Assistance, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1)
description: Monitor reception area, take calls from law enforcement and attorneys, seek to respond to questions and complaints from citizens.

name: Records Retention, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.07
description: Retain files pursuant to office policy.

name: Restitution, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 973.20
description: Determine restitution amount to be ordered by the court, provide this information to the Department of Corrections for collection.

name: Summer Intern Program, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(8)(b)
description: Monitor law school summer interns.

name: Criminal Trials, including assisting victims and witnesses, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 950.04
description: Prepare for and conduct criminal jury trials.

name: Victims Rights, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 950.04
description: Contact and inform crime victims of their rights under statute, inform victims of case status when requested and guide victims through criminal justice system.

name: Witnesses, including subpoenas, cancellations and trial prep, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 950.04
description: Assist in preparing victims & witnesses for trial; escort victims & witnesses into courtroom for trial; cancel witnesses if not needed.

name: Worthless Checks, pursuant to Wis. Stat. 978.05(1) and 973.20
description: Prosecute, draft demand letters and otherwise seek to collect funds for worthless checks written to county businesses.

name: Grant Reporting
description: Monthly expenditure reports to various State Departments to draw down and maximize State funding to run the programs and minimize county levy.  Filing of required State reports including Budgets, Year to Date expenditures, and Reconciliations to obtain continued State/County contract funds for the operations of the Department.

name: Land Information Council Liaison
description: Representative on Land Information Council

name: Customer Concerns & Inquiries - Streets
description: Answer citizen questions on current and upcoming road projects

name: County Property and ROW Research
description: Review title reports and review right of way information for County highways

name: Culvert Inventory
description: Take and maintain an inventory of culverts within county highway ROW

name: Emergency Disaster Response
description: Respond to any disasters in county

name: Land and Right-Of-Way Acquisition
description: Compile pertinent information needed for ROW acquisition. Manage consultants on purchasing of right of way, RFP's for services

name: Right of Way Trimming/Line of Sight
description: Compute right of way for tree removal actives

name: Right Of Way/Property Acquisition Management and Dedication Acceptances
description: Compile pertinent information needed for right-of-way acquisition and conduct acquisition as necessary for county road construction projects. Ensure that consultants have access to all required information.

name: Job Cost Estimates
description: Filling out job estimate materials, labor and equipment

name: Maintain Facility Grounds
description: Lawn mowing, weed control, litter pickup, and vegetation control. Also includes routine maintenance of sidewalk, and park and ride lots.

name: MDSS/AVL-GPS Operations, maintenance, communications
description: GPS Equipment to monitor vehicle operations.  Equipment and labor costs for installation, maintenance, operation and replacement. Ongoing communication costs including charges associated with annual fee, monthly fee, transmittal fee, server fee, Wi-Fi data transfer.

name: Surveying
description: Monuments and survey ROW Delineation

name: Client Flow and Scheduling
description: Checking in outpatient services clients, making reminder calls, rescheduling appointments.  Collecting and scanning client demographic and insurance information.

name: Client Intake
description: Client intake, processing of the welcome packet, collecting all required (non-clinical) paper work, releases of information, scheduling of clients into "appropriate" program, and educating clients regarding program expectations.

name: Client Service Authorizations and Agreements
description: Prepares and tracks service agreements for clients receiving services through the Comprehensive Community Services Program (CCS), maintains and processes correspondence for Chapter 51 settlements and commitments, collects and processes client service units within the EMR, provides clerical support to Community Treatment Services (CTS) staff.

name: Medicare and Medicaid Claims Administration
description: Medicaid claims billing for all BH Programs occurring both on site and many from external providers  (CSP, CCS, ACS, CM, OP, CRS). Staff address all denials and claim rejections. Medicare claims billing for clinic, Outpatient Psychotherapy and Psychiatry Services.

name: Patient Accounting Billing and Payment Administration.
description: Receipting of all Medicare, Medicaid, Private Insurance and patient payments.  Journal Entries Also includes billing, collections and billing assistance.

name: Private Insurance Claims Administration
description: Private Insurance claims billing for clinic.

name: Provider Credentialing and Support
description: Enroll all new providers and maintain existing providers (Therapists and Doctors) in all insurance companies networks to ensure payment for services.  Includes a monthly check to assure continuing credentialing for all staff with clinical licenses. Maintains HSD contract database and maintenance and development of external provider contracts.  Provides clerical support to Behavioral Health Division and Children & Families Division.

name: State Reporting  - Electronic Medical Records
description: Utilizing Electronic Medical Record (EMR) , staff maintain internal and external provider information, collect and input provider service units, and maintain client service programs. Staff work closely with State and County partners to ensure all data is accurate and meet all requirements prior to State reporting.

name: Case Management - At-Risk Adults
description: Continued monitoring, and follow-up for at risk clients subject to financial, physical, emotional abuse or exploitation.

name: Court Services
description: Specialized Testimony, completion of Petitions for at risk clients, and interdisciplinary team reports for the court

name: Court-Ordered Annual Protective Placement Assessment
description: Assessment to determine if client meets legal criteria for Court ordered protective placement.

name: Emergency Services Funds Program
description: Provide funds for needed items to ensure the safety of the client.

name: Guardianship
description: Assistance in filing guardianship for disabled  adults age 18-59 who meet criteria

name: Investigations - Vulnerable Adults at Risk
description: Investigations of cases pertaining to neglect, self-neglect, abuse or financial exploitation.

name: Protective Placement
description: Facilitate a court order to place someone in a safe place.

name: Welfare Checks
description: Unannounced visits to persons who are at risk of neglect or abuse

name: Acute Care
description: 24/7 Mobile Crisis Teams and Call Center that completes crisis assessments, safety plans and serves as a gatekeeper for the Chapter 51 process of emergency detention (working with Law Enforcement).  Works directly in the community with clients, professionals and families in crisis.  Works with Law Enforcement, the Jail, Schools, other systems as needed.  Monitors and supports clients who have through the ACS Program been placed in the hospital.  Works to transition clients safely and with all needed supports back to the community. Support guardianship, case management, court services, protective placements and general support for vulnerable adults and welfare checks in the community.

name: Alcohol and Other Drug Abuse Residential
description: One program, but really is made up of multiple providers in which clients can attend at least 90 days of residential AODA treatment.

name: Alcohol and Other Drug Abuse High School Youth Prevention and Education Programs
description: Run by Elevate, Inc., provides a host of educational and prevention activities and experiences to High School age youth in the community.  The goal of the program is to delay the age of first use for WA County youth.  A part of the program is the administering of SBIRT (Assessment, Identification and Referral Process) and Biomarker drug testing.

name: CCS and CSP - Case Management  and Service Facilitation
description: Case Management for approximately 140 clients with severe and chronic mental illness and AODA concerns; program includes assessment, service plan development, links to other needed services, collateral contacts and teamwork with external providers.  CMs meet regularly with Psychiatrists, Nursing Staff, Therapists, and other connected professionals to assure continuity of care and excellent

name: CCS and CSP - Medication Management
description: Nurses work directly with chronically MI clients, preparing and delivering medications to clients daily.  Med run occurs and is conducted by both SW and MH Tech staff; clients receive medication management and education from RNs and to a lesser extent from SW and Tech staff.  Designed to improve medication adherence and keep clients well, safe and in the community.

name: CCS and CSP - Mental Health Tech Services
description: MH Techs provide a host of daily living skills and other in community supports designed to assist clients to live more independently in the community.  MH Techs provide links to other community providers, take clients shopping, help clients maintain a safe and organized home, deliver and witness med administration, and are an active member of the CCS and CSP teams. Provided by an external agency, Elevate, Inc., and billed through CCS and CSP Programs.  MH Techs provide a host of daily living skills and other in community supports designed to assist clients to live more independently in the community.  MH Techs provide links to other community providers, take clients shopping, help clients maintain a safe and organized home, deliver and witness med administration, and are an active member of the CCS and CSP teams.

name: CCS and CSP-Nursing Services
description: Registered Nurses support clients who are open to the CCS and CSP programs; they are the go between between  client and doctor; they assure timely refills, provide medication management services, receive and communicate lag results, and communicate and provide support for adverse side effects.  RNs serve as a member of the program teams and interact regularly with psychotherapists, CMs, and Psychiatrists.

name: CCS and CSP-Peer Program
description: Operated by NAMI, this program provides a Certified Peer Specialist with lived recivery experience to provide "Health Navigation", Community Navigation and a skill based group experience for clients in our CCS and CSP programs.

name: CCS and CSP-Psychiatry Services
description: Psychiatrists provide initial evaluations, prescriptions, and ongoing medication management to clients with chronic MI and AODA issues within CCS and CSP.

name: CCS and CSP-Psychotherapy Services
description: Licensed Psychotherapists (SWs and Counselors) provide assessments, service plan development, and ongoing, goal oriented psychotherapy for clients with chronic mental illness and AODA concerns with CCS and CSP Programs.

name: Clinic Pharmacy
description: In house, independently owned and operated clinic pharmacy providing all medications to a TBD percentage of the BH client population.  Significant interaction with HSD staff.

name: Community Support Program (CSP) Assessment, Service Plan Development and Administration
description: Intensive CM program that provides at least weekly services to  adults who meet program eligibility .  HSD employs licensed therapists, Bachelor level CMs, Nurses, MH Techs, IPS and some residential services provided by external agencies to improve health outcomes and promote recovery for chronically MI clients.  CSP includes an application and admission process, a comprehensive assessment, service plan development process, and ongoing service delivery, provider management and service coordination.  Clients are reassessed and new plans are developed for each client  every six months.

name: Comprehensive Community Services (CCS) Assessment, Service Plan Development and Administration
description: Intensive CM program that provides more intensive and frequent services to  children and adults who meet program eligibility .  HSD employs licensed therapists, Bachelor level CMs, Nurses, MH Techs, and a host of other external services provided by external agencies to improve health outcomes and promote recovery for chronically MI clients.  CCS includes an application and admission process, a comprehensive assessment, service plan development process, and ongoing service delivery, provider management and service coordination.  Clients are reassessed and new plans are developed for each client  every six months.

name: Family Care Allocation
description: HSD allocates a predetermined amount annually to in part fund Family Care (Partnership Program, Family Care Program) Services for Washington County residents.  WA County residents who meet the functional and financial requirements for the program gain access to team-based care, some of which is funded directly by a Managed Care Organization and some of it funded through State Medicaid insurance.  Access to the program is accomplished through contact with the Aging and Disability Resource Center (ADRC), who completes a functional screen and assessment on the client.  Our own Economic Support Division supplies financial eligibility information to the ADRC, and then admission is determined.

name: AODA Outpatient Services
description: Provides AODA outpatient services to groups and indivudal clients with MA or no insurance.  A good number of uninsured or MA insured IDP clients utilize this program for treatment.  Treatment includes assessment, service planning, and ongoing treatment.

name: Inpatient Hospitalization
description: Multiple providers across the region who accept voluntary and involuntary clients for mental health hospitalizations, crisis stabilization and transition back to the community.

name: Intoxicated Driver Program
description: Managed by Elevate, Inc. , this program assesses and creates a safety plan for all clients who have been charged with an OWI Offense.  Clients pay for the assessment and safety plan process and then follow through on recommendations per safety plan with other tx or educational providers in the community. The program is completely client-funded and operational costs do not hit the County's books.

name: 24/7 Residential Services (includes Supportive HC/Apartment, CBRF, and AFH)
description: Includes varying degrees of 24/7 support and skill delivery for clients who are struggling with chronic mental illness and requires a much more in depth level of support and attention.  Clients in this program cannot live safely in the community, take their medication independently, routinely, and are at risk for being exploited.

name: Lifespan - Community Outpatient Services Case Management
description: Case Management for approximately 100 clients with severe and chronic mental illness and substance use disorders; program includes assessment, service plan development, links to other needed services, collateral contacts and teamwork with external providers.  CMs meet regularly with Psychiatrists, Nursing Staff, Therapists, and other connected professionals to assure continuity of care and excellent client outcomes.

name: Lifespan - Intake & Orientation
description: Client contacts via phone and walk in, Client intake, processing of the welcome packet, collecting all required (non-clinical) paper work, releases of information, scheduling of client into "appropriate" program, and educating clients regarding expectations.

name: Lifespan - Nursing Services
description: Registered Nurses (RN) support clients who are open to the Lifespan Psychiatry program; they are the go between between client and doctor; they assure timely refills, provide medication management services, receive and communicate lag results, and communicate and provide support for adverse side effects.  RNs serve as a member of the Lifespan team and interact regularly with psychotherapists, case managers, and Psychiatrists.

name: Lifespan - Psychiatry Services
description: Psychiatrists provide initial evaluations, prescriptions, and ongoing medication management to clients with chronic MI and AODA issues.

name: Lifespan - Psychotherapy Service
description: Licensed Psychotherapists (SWs and Counselors) provide assessments, service plan development, and ongoing, goal oriented psychotherapy for clients with chronic mental illness and AODA concerns.

name: Patient Assistance Program
description: Brief assessment, application processing, and ongoing check in and support for uninsured clients with needs for psychotropic medications (and no ability to pay).  Medications are provided free of charge or for small co-pays from pharmaceutical corporations.

name: Representative Payee Program
description: Provided by an in house HSD staff and MH Tech.  Serves as Rep Payee for 85 clients who are open in CCS, CSP, and COPS Programs.  Balances accounts, processes and provides checks, pays bills, helps assure eligibility timelines for insurance and SSI are met.

name: Saint A - School Based Trauma Informed Psychotherapy Services
description: Run by Saint A, this program serves approximately 50 children per year, providing Trauma Informed Psychotherapy to children who have experienced an adverse event and are acting out and struggling in school.  Designed to be a preventative program that can keep children out of the more formal BH System.  Program also works to build trauma informed and sensitive schools, training teachers, child by child, helping them understand and implement better behavior support plans.

name: Treatment, Alternatives and Diversion (TAD) Program
description: Run by Elevate, Inc., this program is designed to divert jail and prison bed days and mandate treatment instead for clients who have received 2nd, 3rd, and 4th time Operating while Intoxicated offenses.  Program includes assessment, service planning, frequent client contact, linkages to treatment and drug testing.

name: Birth to Three Program
description: Implement in-home services to children with 25% or more deficits in speech/language and physical abilities.

name: Children's Waivers
description: Provide daily living skills, community support and respite.

name: Children's Long-Term Support (CLTS) Program
description: 3 (FT) Children's Long-Term Support workers (CLTS) are responsible for the implementation of the CLTS programs which includes adhering to the State Waiver mandates, following all Family Support Guidelines assisting families in maintaining their special needs children within their homes and all related case management duties.

name: Family Support
description: Funding allotted to families for disability related expenses that are not covered by T19, Katie Beckett or private insurance.

name: Acute Care - Psychiatry
description: Staff psychiatrist.

name: Case Management - MH and AODA
description: Case management for behavioral health programs.

name: Psychiatric Evaluations
description: Program includes records reviews and face to face evaluations of clients who are either on commitment, or have been placed in an inpatient unit (emergency detained).  Part of Washington Countys mandate to assure residents are not a danger to themselves or others.

name: NAMI-Drop in Center
description: Program provides a community center environment and best practice programming for residents with chronic mental health illness.  Provides group programming for residents using Recovery International, Peer to Peer and Family to Family Programming.

name: Transitional Apartments
description: Provides four studio apartments to help clients with chronic mental illness.

name: Dodge County Clearview Mental Health Facility-IMD
description: Locked mental health facility in Juno, WI used for clients who are a danger to themselves, are on commitment with WA County, and need the increased security and support to develop the skills to live independently and safely in the community.

name: Easter Seals-Guardianship
description: Provides a corporate guardian for clients who are found incompetent, have no family or friends to fill the need, and in need of a guardian.

name: Child Protective Services (CPS) - Access and Initial Assessment
description: 5 Full Time MSWs are responsible for Access and Initial Assessment duties in Child Protective Services as mandated by Chapter 48 of the Wisconsin State Statutes.  This unit is responsible for screening decisions on all CPS referrals, conducting all investigations and CPS court referrals.

name: Child Protective Services (CPS) - Alternate Care
description: 2 (FT) MSWs and 1(FT) BSW perform all mandated activities pertaining to a child in an out-of-home placement.  This includes court work, paperwork as mandated by DCF, face-to-face contacts and coordination of all services.

name: Brighter Futures Program
description: Assessment and support services to parents and youth who have co-occurring AODA and delinquency issues.

name: Court Assessments
description: 2 (FT) Social Worker positions are responsible for conducting all interviews and information gathering related to the development of a report to court which includes recommendations for disposition.

name: Court Intake
description: 1 (FT) Social Worker position is responsible for receiving, screening, and managing all Juvenile Intake referrals from law enforcement.

name: Family Court
description: 2 (FT) Masters Level Social Workers, each have half (1/2) their caseload dedicated to Family Court Services.  These positions conduct court-ordered custody investigations and make recommendations to the court on custody and placement of children when their parents are unable to resolve this independently.

name: Forensic Interviewer
description: Conduct video-recorded Forensic Interviews on child maltreatment cases.

name: Foster Care Coordinator
description: 1 (PT) BSW is responsible for managing all Kinship Care placements, as well as recruiting, licensing, training and maintaining foster homes for Washington County.

name: GPS Monitoring (Global Positioning Satellite)
description: Monitors youth who are court-ordered to wear an electronic monitoring unit.

name: Kinship Care Benefits Program
description: Provides funds to unlicensed relative care providers.

name: Mentoring
description: Provides one-on-one support to kids who require positive adult interaction.

name: Child Protective Services (CPS) - Ongoing Monitoring and Case Management
description: 1 (FT) MSW and 3 (FT) Bachelor of Social Work (BSW) level staff are responsible for the implementation of all court orders pertaining to Child Abuse and Neglect.  Workers monitor for safety and compliance, conduct home visits, develop treatment plans, complete all state mandated paperwork, and meet all state-required time frames.  Workers are responsible for all court related activity as well as service referrals and case management activity.

name: Juvenile Justice (JJ) - Ongoing Monitoring and Case Management
description: 4 (FT) MSWs and 3 (FT) BSWs are responsible for providing all duties associated with court-ordered supervision.  This includes, conducting home visits, developing treatment plans, court work, all case management duties and complying with all DCF and DOC mandates, guidelines and timeframes.

name: Out-of-Home Care
description: Provide structure, support and programming for children and youth unable to be maintained in their home.  Services include individual, group and family therapy, education, recreation and medical coordination.  Provides facilities licensed by the State of Wisconsin in the areas of:  Treatment Foster Care, Residential Care Centers and Corrections (Lincoln Hills).

name: Parent Aides
description: 1 (FT) and 2 (PT) Family Aides are trained to provide the Nurturing Program, Budgeting, Household Management, Parenting and referrals to community supports/resources.  They are also responsible for transportation and  monitoring all court-ordered supervised visitation.

name: Parenting Education & Support
description: Provision of parent education and groups with a focus on nurturing and support.

name: Post Unification Program
description: Funding is intended to be used to support the needs of reunified families.

name: Restorative Justice
description: Provides programming to youth on supervision that have court orders for restitution, community service and/or Restorative Justice.

name: Safety Services
description: Provides services to insure children can safely remain in their home.

name: Shelter/Youth Treatment Center
description: Provides a 14-bed facility offering services to Shelter (6-bed capacity) and residential treatment (8-bed capacity) placements.

name: Supervised Visitation
description: Provides a structured, home-like atmosphere to those parents requiring supervised contact with their children.

name: Truancy Intake & Assessment
description: 1 (PT) Social Worker is responsible for conducting all interviews and information gathering for screening of truancy referrals, developing deferred prosecutions or completing the court referral process.

name: Benefit Recovery/Fraud Prevention and Investigation
description: Discrepancy data matches and fraud referrals are received and investigated for overpayments and fraud across all programs. Often requires requesting third party verification from employers and other sources. Investigations are completed using outside data sources and claims are established and entered into Benefit Recovery system. Fair Hearing research, response and attendance. Benefit recovery and fraud activities for Income Maintenance are part of the Income Maintenance Consortium model.

name: Program Prescreening and Support (Income Maintenance, Child Care, Energy Assistance)
description: Prescreens and schedules Intake (interview) appointments for Foodshare, Childcare subsidy and Energy Assistance. Applications are received via Access online or paper applications. Schedules Foodshare and Childcare annual renewals (interviews) that are received through Access (online) or paper. Assigns Healthcare only and Caretaker Supplement applications to the appropriate caseload for processing by Economic Support Specialists. These tasks are completed for Ozaukee and Walworth counties as well as Washington County. Scans all necessary case documentation that is processed first into the Income Maintenance electronic case files. Manages the Fair Hearing tracking tool in State system and the Fair Hearing e mail inbox for all 5 counties in the Moraine Lakes Consortium. Prescreens and schedules appointments for Energy Assistance. Provides reception duties for all programs. Scans documents received at front desk. Completes filing. Scans Childrens Long Term Support files. Open and closing of service files for Children and Families and file retention for same. Completes positive ID verification for WE Energies.

name: Public Land Survey System Monument Maintenance and Surveying
description: Monument maintenance program is Wisconsin Land Information Program Funded. Also assist the county surveyor maintain the network through field work and dossier drafting.

name: Medico-Legal Death Investigation
description: Investigate deaths reported to our office under Wi St. 979.01. Includes transporting decedents from scene of death to morgue or autopsy facility as necessary.

name: Death Certificate Signing
description: Investigate deaths reported to our office to determine cause and manner of death and sign the death certificate according to the findings of the investigation as required by State Statute.

name: Cremation Permitting
description: Make personal inquiry into cause and manner of death of all persons who will be cremated as required by State Statute. View the decedent. Issue a permit.

name: Forensic Autopsy
description: Contracted with Waukesha County for some forensic autopsy services.

name: External Examination
description: Perform a complete external examination of a decedent in all reported cases where the Medical Examiner will determine cause and manner of death and case circumstances do not warrant an autopsy be performed.

name: Medical Records Administration and Maintenance
description: Maintain files, fulfill open records requests

name: Retail and Deli Inventory Control
description: Monthly physical counts of golf shop and deli inventories are completed by the Accounting Supervisor and the golf  staff.

name: Golf Staff In-house Training and Certifications
description: Hands on training is completed onsite by experienced golf staff.  Training required for professional certification and credentials is done through the agency responsible for the license or an approved agent.

name: Groundwater Protection and Awareness
description: Citizens are provided information in various forms (website, GIS, etc...) to raise awareness for both groundwater quality and quantity protection.

name: Tree & Prairie Seed Sales Program
description: Citizens are provided an opportunity to purchase low cost native trees, wildlife shrubs, prairie seed and other conservation related accouterments.

name: Planning & Parks Customer Inquiries and Assistance
description: Assist customers at the counter to provide helpful information to the public regarding Planning and Parks Department programs.

name: Aquatic Invasive Species Plan Research, Writing, Adoption and Administration
description: The Aquatic Invasive Species Plan was completed as part of a WI DNR grant and was adopted in Feb. 2013 by the County Board with a recommendation to be updated every five years.  Planning Division developed the Plan and  updates periodically.  Work includes plan research and writing, statistical analysis, development of goals & recommendations and Plan adoption.

name: Assessment Training
description: Assessors are reimbursed by the county for travel expenses  to annual state mandated assessment training.

name:
Constituent Assistance - Termination of Interest
and Beneficiary Transfers
description: Assist constituents in completing termination of decedent's interest forms. Researching real estate records for completeness.

name: Federal Tax Liens
description:
Accept Internal Revenue Service (IRS) federal tax liens, review for statutory requirements, receipt statutory fees,
index, scan, and return mail.  Endorse each document with date, time, county name and consecutive unique document number.

name: Genealogy Assistance
description:
Assist citizens in researching family history, including real estate and vital records.  Issuing copies of said records
and collect statutory fees.

name: Marital Property Agreements Recording & Indexing
description:
Accept real estate documents, review for statutory requirements, receipt statutory fees, index, scan, and return mail.
Endorse each document with date, time, county name and consecutive unique document number.

name: Notary Public Services
description: Provide notary public service to citizens, assist with various termination document preparation.

name:
Website Maintenance - Real Estate
and Vital Records
description: Provide real estate and vital record information on county website, including but not limited to forms, links, schedules, fees,

name: Annual Reporting
description: Preparation of the annual report and related documents.

name: Civil Process
description: Administration of civil process procedures as mandated by law.

name: Citizen's Customer Service (In Person/Phone)
description: Assisting citizens who come to front office for services.  Taking and routing phone calls that are received in administration area. Services provided through direct contact with citizens via the front counter.

name: Mobile Data Terminals
description: Maintenance of the mobile data terminals installed in department squads.

name: NIBRS/UCR Statistics Reporting
description: Reporting of crime statistics via the Uniform Crime reporting system or the National Incident-Based Reporting System.

name: Open Records & Records Retention
description: Management of open records processes and retention and archiving of open records.

name: Public Information & Media Relations
description: Provide information to the public and media via direct communication, press releases or other formats.

name: Records Processing
description: Management of front office records processes such as dictation, documentation, records flow, routing and storage.

name: RMS Systems Administration
description: Administration and maintenance of the department's Record Management System.

name: Mapping and GIS Management
description: Liaison with county GIS, town and county governments to maintain accurate     9-1-1 address mapping throughout the county.

name: Quality Assurance & Training
description: Review and documentation of dispatcher performance through objective and quantified analysis of call handling. Monthly training program.

name: RMS / CAD Systems Administration
description: Administration and maintenance of the department's Record Management System and Computer Aided Dispatch system.

name: Chaplain and Religious Services
description: One LTD Jail Chaplain who oversees the religious needs of the facility.  There are also several community volunteers who assist with various group activities and programming.

name: Food Service for Adult Inmates
description: The Food Service ensures that the dietary needs of the adult inmate population are being met on a daily basis by providing three meals a day as mandated by the State of Wisconsin.

name: Food Service for Juvenile Inmates
description: The Food Service ensures that the dietary needs of the juvenile inmate population are being met on a daily basis by providing three meals a day as mandated by the State of Wisconsin.

name: Incarceration of Adult Inmates - Straight Time
description: The general incarceration of inmates from pre-sentence detainees through sentenced detainees (without Huber).  This is done in compliance with Wisconsin DOC 350.

name: Incarceration of Juvenile Inmates for other Counties.
description: Our Juvenile Secure Facility currently boards inmates from several Counties throughout Wisconsin, including Dodge, Jefferson, Kenosha, Ozaukee, and, Waukesha Counties.  This is done in compliance with Wisconsin DOC 346.

name: Incarceration of Washington County Juveniles
description: The general incarceration of Juvenile Offenders who are residents of Washington County.  This is done in compliance with Wisconsin DOC 346.

name: Juvenile Programming Services
description: Our juvenile population is required, by Wisconsin DOC 346,to have certain amounts of programming each day.  These programs include education, exercise, AODA counseling, etc.

name: Medical Services for Adult Inmates
description: The Medical Services Program is responsible for the medical needs of the adult inmates incarcerated in the Jail on any given day.  This is required by Wisconsin Statute DOC 350.

name: Medical Services for Juvenile Inmates
description: The Medical Services Program is responsible for the medical needs of all of the juvenile inmates incarcerated in the Jail on any given day.  This is required by Wisconsin Statute DOC 346.

name: Mental Health Services for Adult Inmates
description: The Mental Health Services Program is responsible for the mental health needs of all of the adult inmates incarcerated in the Jail on any given day.  This is required by Wisconsin DOC 350.

name: Mental Health Services for Juvenile Inmates
description: The Mental Health Services Program is responsible for the mental health  needs of all of the inmates incarcerated in the Jail on any given day.  This is required by Wisconsin DOC 346.

name: Security Systems Repair & Maintenance
description: This program is responsible for the repair, maintenance, and replacement of video cameras and locking systems that are not covered by the County's Facilities Department.

name: Most Wanted Files
description: Public relations program highlighting wanted criminals which are featured in the media and department website.

name: Employment Background Investigations
description: Conducting background investigation for corrections, communications and patrol candidates.

name: Evidence & Property Management
description: Management of the department's evidence and evidence storage, forensic analysis, transport of evidence and records maintenance

name: Forensic Video Management
description: Management of the department's interview video and audio recording systems.

name: Building Tours
description: Building tours for multiple community groups and organizations. .

name: Community Safety & Crime Prevention Presentations
description: Presentations of programs related to crime, crime prevention, personal safety, and civics to multiple community groups and organizations.

name: County Fair
description: Management of the countywide law enforcement display at the annual County Fair.

name: Drug Abuse resistance & Education (DARE)
description: Drug Abuse Resistance & Education courses taught in community schools.

name: Every 15 Minutes
description: Participation in the every 15 Minutes program provided to educate high school age students on the danger of drunk driving.

name: Shop with a Cop
description: Participation in the Shop With a Cop program which provides holiday programs for disadvantaged youth.

name: Civil Process
description: Attempts and service of civil process by the patrol division.

name: Recreational Patrol
description: Recreational enforcement activity with the use of specialized vehicles.

name: School Visits
description: Program in which deputies conduct personal visits to schools located in the county.

name: Special Deputy Contract Work
description: Dedicated time for contract work assignments conducted by part time Special Deputies and full time deputies.

name: Special Teams
description: Activity associated with the management, training and deployment of the department's SWAT, Dive, Canine and Accident Reconstruction Teams.

name: Town Liaison
description: Program in which deputies serve as liaisons to town government to foster better communication, education and cooperation.

name: Radio Infrastructure Maintenance
description: Maintenance and oversight of the county wide radio system tower sites and related infrastructure.

name: Radio Network Administration & Maintenance
description: Administration of the county wide radio system IT network.

name: Drug Clean Sweep
description: Participation in county's drug take-back program.

name: Drug Unit Grant & Asset Forfeiture Programs
description: Administration of state and federal grants related to drug enforcement.

name: College Intern Program
description: Administration of college intern program through local technical colleges.

name: Defibrillator Program
description: Maintenance and testing of department and other county owned AEDs.

name: Repair Work
description: Repair in shop of vehicles due to malfunction or damage.

name: Scheduled Maintenance
description: Scheduled and routine maintenance of fleet vehicles such as oil changes, brake replacements, etc.

name: Shop Maintenance
description: Maintaining shop inventory, equipment and supplies.

name: Squad Set Up
description: Annual tear down of existing squads and setup of replacement squads.

name: Warranty & Repair Service
description: Scheduling, pick up and delivery of fleet vehicles and equipment undergoing warranty or repair service through local dealers.

name: Adult Volunteer Educational Support
description: Trains adult volunteers to provide safe, interactive, and positive learning experiences as they mentor young people in Washington County.

name: Agricultural & Industrial Society Partnership (County Fair Support)
description: Collaboration with Fair Park staff to manage lease agreement between 4-H & AIS. Provides educational support and volunteer coordination for County Fair.

name: Community Youth Development
description: Reaches underserved youth in Washington County to provide experiential learning programs including camps, workshops, and training.

name: Horticulture
description: Coordinates and trains Master Gardener Program Volunteers who provide consumer horticultural education & community service.

name: Home and Community Education
description: Provides support for educational programs through community club programs and volunteerism.

name: Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program-Education/Foodwise
description: Provides direct education to limited resource residents;  participates in health &  food security collaborations (pantries, coalitions);  administers Program.

name: Memorial Day Flag Program
description: Coordinate volunteers, order necessary flags and flag holders to be placed on graves of veterans buried in Washington County

name: Military Day at County Fair
description: Assist in coordination and scheduling of events honoring veterans at the annual County Fair

name: Presidential Memorial Certificates
description: Apply for Presidential Memorial Certificates for families of deceased veterans.

name: VA Grave Markers Assistance
description: Assist families in submission of applications for VA Memorial Markers

name: Wisconsin State Park Pass
description: Verify eligibility for the WI DNR Park Pass program for disabled veterans

name: Veteran Drivers License Designation Assistance
description: Assist eligible veterans in submitting request to WI DMV to have "Veteran" added to their drivers license

name: Computer Forensic Crime Lab
description: Investigate crimes where a computer  or other technology  was utilized to commit the crime to include Child Pornography and Child Abuse in the protection of our community children serving on the Cyber Crimes Task Force.

name: Citizen Ride Along
description: Citizen ride along program with a patrol officer this could include members of the community, media, or those interested in law enforcement career.

name: Recruitment
description: Recruit officers, dispatchers, detention officers and laterals by actively advertising, attending job and career fairs, and local educational institutions.

name: Honor Guard Program
description: Perform ceremonial events that require the United States flag as well as funerals, services, and City Events.

name: Election Administration
description: Administer municipal elections and conduct them in and ethical manner in accordance with the law

name: Records Requests
description: Receive and process requests to inspect records in accordance with the Inspection of Public Records Act and organization's policy

name: Archives
description: Identifying, preserving, and making available records of enduring value

name: Cemetery Operations
description: Maintain cemetery turf and infrastructure. Process requests to access sites, sale of plots and services. Open and close sites and provide access to columbarium areas. Manage cemetery expansion through the Cemetery Master Plan. Maintain records. Manage and operate in accordance with the Cemetery Bylaw and Cemeteries Act.

name: Customer Service and Cash Receipting
description: Receive cash, check and credit card payments over the counter, receive deposits from decentralized locations, record payments, create daily deposit. Reconcile cash drawers and daily deposits. Maintain deposit records. Research and resolve discrepancies and customer or bank inquiries. Administer NSF/Short Checks process. Answer phone calls related to utility billing and general inquiries.

name: Records and Plan Retention
description: Maintain construction plans and Planning and Zoning documents for future reference.

name: Cemetery Services
description: Provide excavation of plots, selling of plot easements, fee management and deposits, customer service.

name: Cemetery Building and Grounds Maintenance
description: Overall grounds maintenance for 30 acres of cemetery land including turf management, mowing, headstone and cremation location maintenance.

name: Case Processing
description: Process all court proceedings, docket all actions taken with appropriate docket code.

name: Case Management
description: Process tickets, monitor pending caseload, maintain court calendar, process exhibits.

name: Court Records Management
description: Maintain all court records in compliance with Office of State Court Administrator (OSCA) rules.

name: Bonds
description: Process all bonds for traffic or misdemeanor cases

name: Customer Service
description: Assist citizens at the counte or via telephone with records requests or taking payments

name: Landfill Compliance Monitoring
description: Closure post closure care landfill permitting and amendments

name: Location Services
description: Locate of underground utilities

name: Electric Reporting
description: Maintain daily, monthly and yearly logs for reporting.

name: Regional Coordination
description: Support regional efforts through participation in regional decision-making organizations to advance shared interests.

name: Land & Right-of-Way (ROW) Acquisition
description: Acquisition of land, right-of-way, permanent easements and temporary easements needed as part of a capital improvement program.  This also includes release or transfer of property no longer needed. Develops / verifies Legal descriptions for easements, rights-of-way, dedications, etc.

name: Court Security/Bailiff
description: Providing Court Security during Court Sessions and processing those sentenced.

name: Police Firearms Range
description: peration and maintenance of Police Firearms Range

name: Bio-solids land application
description: Tracking, reporting and testing of land applied solids to include field testing.

name: Weddings and Civil Ceremony
description: Longmont Municipal Court provides a low cost, easily accessible service for members of this community to have wedding and civil ceremonies performed.

name: Spring clean-up week
description: Spring clean-up week for residents to get rid of unwanted items

name: Council Meetings and Work Sessions
description: Preside at meetings of the governing body
